result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:23 AM case called. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek J. Hoffman appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Derek J. Hoffman. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek J. Hoffman appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Derek J. Hoffman. The parties are close to an agreement. Defendant waives right to appear in person. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case referred to Br. 1 for scheduling.

Attorney Hillestad was recently appointed, however represents a co-defendant. Therefore the PD office will need to appoint new counsel and Attorney Hillestad will need to file a Order to Withdraw. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/27/22 at 1:45pm.

Defendant needs to get fingerprints done.
